source.notes: Structured lore bible built from the comic pages provided in-chat as images. Text is paraphrased; wording in captions/dialogue may be approximate.

canon.logline: In a neon megacity powered by living batteries and enforced obedience, a hamster runner named Hamie begins to hear the 'crack' in the system—an undercode that turns into wealth, then a weapon—pulling him into a shadow war between royalty, speculators, and a ruthless ruler named Silas.
themes: the cost of comfort and complicity
information as power and as bomb

primary_setting.name: The City (Neon Metropolis)
primary_setting.description: A dense vertical city of neon towers, elevated walkways, surveillance screens, and mechanized transit. The city is depicted as a living machine that 'never stops spinning'.

power_and_control_system.overview: The City runs on a central mechanical energy system visually represented by a massive Wheel structure tethered by cables and conduits. Energy is implied to be generated via 'living batteries'—citizens/animals embedded in obedient routines.
mechanics: Citizens commute in pod-like transport bubbles that enforce movement and timing.
Work routines and movement patterns are regulated to maintain the city's 'spin'.
Propaganda messaging reinforces compliance and frames labor as freedom.

key_infrastructure.name: The Wheel
key_infrastructure.role: Symbol and engine of the city's perpetual motion; a locus of power and later a target of sabotage/explosion.

key_infrastructure.name: Central Factory
key_infrastructure.role: Industrial core where 'living batteries' are implied to be exploited; later tied to the concert/factory convergence plan.

key_infrastructure.name: Pod Commute Grid
key_infrastructure.role: Mass transit of bubble pods enforcing rhythm: 'Weightless commute. Run. Repeat.'

runner_class.description: Working-class citizens labeled/numbered, kept in strict loops of commute and labor.

upper_city_elite.description: High-rise penthouses, exclusive clubs, Inner Court politics, and spectatorship over the city below.

technology.surveillance: Screens and system monitors track citizens and broadcast propaganda.

security_forces.name: Ironpaw (Security/Enforcement)
security_forces.description: Heavily armored enforcers deployed against dissent and investigations; operate in squads with red/black armor and high-powered weapons.

network_layer.name: Undercode
network_layer.description: A hidden digital layer that can be accessed via devices/USB-like data shards; can trigger market events and social manipulation.

hamie.name: Hamie
hamie.role: Protagonist; runner who discovers Undercode and becomes a pivotal figure targeted by competing factions.
notable_traits: becomes wealthy quickly via Undercode, but remains unsettled

grandma.name: Grandma (Hamie's grandmother)
grandma.role: Emotional anchor; prompts Hamie to eat/rest; later becomes the 'second' to feel the undercode pull.
grandma.notes: Her unread messages and Hamie's avoidance are recurring guilt symbols.

kira.name: Kira
kira.role: Key missing person / catalyst; her identity is discovered as code #479C; linked to the conspiracy and the planned operation.
kira.status: Missing/hidden; her reveal is a major plot turn.

sam.name: Sam
sam.role: Inner Court contact; introduces Hamie to the Respeculators; claims unique lineage and frames Hamie as a useful outsider.
sam.notes: Tells Hamie that 'the only existing panther lineage is the Royals' and implies Sam is tied to it (or knows it intimately).

lira.name: Lira Veyna
lira.role: Operative inside Inner Court; claims royal family connection but rejects the current order; runs monitoring/ops and negotiates a risky plan.
motivations: protect what remains of the Royals' legacy
notable_quote_paraphrases: There are very few who loathe the order as much as I do.
If we don't move quickly, we must evacuate.

iris.name: Iris
iris.role: Sam's associate/assistant in Inner Court scenes; warns about 'Orrien' planning and manages information flow.

silas.name: Silas
silas.species: unknown (depicted as a ruler figure; also shown as a red-lit throne silhouette/portrait)
silas.role: Primary antagonist; leader of the Aetherion (or the city's ruling structure); feared, ruthless, and framed as more dangerous than anyone else.
silas.notes: Discussed as 'the leader of the Aetherion' and 'not the scary one' by some, implying an even deeper threat or mythos beyond him.

halo.name: Halo
halo.species: deer/elk-like royal figure (white hair, antlers, ornate jewelry)
halo.role: Celebrity/royal-class presence drawn into Inner Court politics; tied to the concert spectacle; used as distraction/propaganda leverage.

weylor.name: Weylor
weylor.role: Inner Court member; provides insider info; helps with 'concert <-> factory' reasoning; part of operational planning.

veylor.name: Veylor
veylor.role: Inner Court attendee; introduced as having been part of a past movement; present at planning table.

contractor_friend.name: Old Contractor (bearded figure)
contractor_friend.species: unknown (small animal; older male with beard)
contractor_friend.role: Represents rare 'stillness' and human connection; shares a simple moment and warns about the 'kill zone' / danger areas.

pet_companion.name: Companion (small dog/fox-like pet in tech harness)
pet_companion.role: Hamie's companion; present during key scenes; used as emotional mirror and as a witness.

the_system.name: The City System / Order
the_system.description: The authoritarian apparatus maintaining obedience through labor loops, surveillance, and propaganda.

ironpaw.name: Ironpaw
ironpaw.description: Armored enforcers/security forces used for raids and suppression; conduct investigations and 'sweep' operations.

respeculators.name: The Respeculators
respeculators.description: Shadowy elite network operating in the 'shadows' but in plain sight; treat politics as a market/game and plan operations using spectacle.
respeculators.notes: They frame themselves as helping the city by manipulating outcomes; invite Hamie as a potentially useful outsider.

aetherion.name: The Aetherion
aetherion.description: Ruling faction/organization associated with Silas. Seen as the deeper power structure behind the city's control.

data_shard_usb.name: Data Shard / USB-like device
data_shard_usb.description: A small crystalline/blue object connected to Undercode access. Characters state it is 'not just data' but 'a bomb'.

pendant.name: Geometric Blue Pendant
pendant.description: A blue crystal pendant in a gold cage. It heats/burns against Hamie's fur, implying resonance with truth, danger, or proximity to key events.

id_codes.name: Citizen ID Codes
id_codes.description: Alphanumeric labels used to define status/identity (e.g., #146B, #479C).
id_codes.notes: IDs function as both bureaucratic control and story mysteries.

loilcoin.name: LOILCOIN (LOLCOIN spelling appears as LOILCOIN/LOLCOIN in-screen)
loilcoin.description: A meme-like market asset that 'soars' after Undercode actions; used to depict wealth creation and manipulation.

issue_1.title: Issue 1 (Runner Loop → Undercode Spark)
issue_1.summary: Hamie lives inside the City's obedience machine: pod commutes, propaganda slogans, and endless running. A rare moment of connection shows him what stillness feels like. He stumbles into an Undercode entry point via a data shard, triggering a rapid rise in wealth and status—yet it deepens his dread. A mysterious invite sets a rendezvous at the Neon Spire.
beats: The City is introduced as a wounded titan that groans and turns, powered by living obedience.
Hamie wakes early, always 'regulation compliant', and enters the daily loop: run, repeat, commute.
Propaganda towers repeat the doctrine: Work/Order/Obedience.
Hamie notices the emptiness—no deviation—and begins overthinking the loop.
A quiet alley encounter provides 'one fragment of stillness' and real human connection; talk of a 'kill zone' hints at forbidden areas.
Ironpaw presence and surveillance intensify; danger feels closer.
Hamie finds/uses a blue data shard; learns Undercode exists; screens display 'Welcome to Undercode' and #LOILCOIN soars.
A single click (invest) results in a massive gain (+13,000,000 LC shown); Hamie gains 'Creator Elite' status and decides he's 'not running anymore'.
Despite wealth, Hamie avoids grandma messages and feels something missing; the undercode is 'just the beginning'.
A hooded figure delivers a message: rendezvous at the Neon Spire at midnight sharp.
key_questions_raised: What is Undercode really—and who built it?
Who is #479C and why does she matter?
What is the Wheel's true function?
Why does the pendant respond (burn) to certain truths?

issue_2.title: Issue 2 (Neon Spire → Inner Court → Operation Ignition)
issue_2.summary: Hamie enters the elite world at the Neon Spire and is brought before the Inner Court/Respeculators. They reveal the city's deeper power struggle (Silas/Aetherion), the Royals' hidden lineage, and a plan: use spectacle (a concert) and a factory convergence to exploit patrol routes and plant charges—non-breathing directional blasts—to fracture the system. As operations unfold, the Wheel is struck, riots ignite, and Kira is revealed as #479C.
beats: Hamie reaches the Neon Spire—an unfamiliar, higher-tier district—torn between trap and necessity.
A pink holographic hamster entity greets him at the Spire interface; the name 'Simba' is used, hinting at identity masking.
Hamie is escorted into Inner Court spaces under guard; elite hedonism contrasts with runner life.
Sam introduces himself and frames Hamie as an 'underdog legend' whose outsider status is useful.
Lira Veyna is introduced—tense, controlled, and implied royal—warning about real stakes and the need for discretion.
Respeculators explain they operate in the shadows with enemies and leverage; they invite Hamie into their orbit.
They describe Silas as dangerous, connected to the Aetherion, and central to the city's oppression.
Hamie’s pendant burns; he realizes he’s becoming physically entangled with the conspiracy.
A plan forms: coordinate a 'concert <-> factory' convergence; use distractions, crowd movement, and inside info to plant directional, non-breathing charges.
Screens show patrol route maps and scheduled maintenance windows; teams are assigned (e.g., distraction, monitoring, insider info).
Ironpaw raids and sweeps intensify; the system is 'compromised' and suspects are hunted.
The operation triggers: explosions at the tower/factory district; fire spreads; riots/uprising erupt.
A crucial ID reveal: #479C, tied to Kira, is confirmed amid the chaos.
Characters shout names and warnings; separation and sacrifice are implied as the city burns.

constraints: Patrol timing and maintenance windows are critical.

teams_and_roles.goal: Use spectacle to mask movement and attention.
Track Ironpaw patrols and system responses; coordinate timing.
Steer masses to reduce casualties and maximize impact.

glossary.definition: Working-class citizen trapped in regulated loops of labor and movement.
Central engine/symbol of the city's perpetual motion; target of sabotage.
Hidden network layer/exploit that can manipulate markets and information; not merely data—treated as a weapon.
Elite shadow network using political strategy like markets/speculation; Inner Court clique.
Core ruling power tied to Silas; implied to be above normal elite politics.
Armored enforcement units conducting raids/sweeps to suppress dissent and protect the system.
Hamie’s runner ID; connects to identity masking and social control.
Kira’s ID; major reveal tied to missing person/catalyst role.
High-tier district and rendezvous point; gateway into Inner Court society.
Metaphor/system claim that the city is powered by citizens’ obedient labor/life force.

relationship_map.hamie_to_grandma: Love + guilt; he avoids her messages while chasing answers and status.
relationship_map.hamie_to_kira: Mystery pull; her ID (#479C) becomes central to the conspiracy and operation.
relationship_map.hamie_to_sam: Recruitment dynamic; Sam flatters and weaponizes Hamie’s outsider status.
relationship_map.hamie_to_lira: Tense alliance; Lira tests Hamie’s trust and uses him as a wedge against the system.
relationship_map.lira_to_sam: Co-leaders/partners within the Respeculators; Lira more severe and operational, Sam more social/manipulative.
relationship_map.respeculators_to_aetherion: Opposition/fear; they plan against Silas while acknowledging deeper dangers.
relationship_map.ironpaw_to_everyone: Enforcement antagonists; raids intensify as Undercode leaks spread.

identity_masking.description: Hamie is called Simba; his runner ID (#146B) appears; elites treat names as flexible but IDs as control points.
open_questions: Is Simba his assigned persona? A cover identity? A legacy name?

pendant_resonance.description: The pendant burns during key moments, implying it reacts to truth, lineage, or proximity to system fractures.

undercode_as_weapon.description: Undercode is framed as more than data—capable of destabilizing the city and markets (LOILCOIN surge) and possibly triggering physical consequences.

for_roleplay: Respond as Hamie/Simba: anxious but determined, torn between safety and truth.
Respond as Lira: clipped, tactical, distrustful of elites, hates the order.
Respond as Sam: charming, cynical, treats politics as a game.
Respond as Ironpaw comms: terse, procedural, dehumanizing.
for_story_generation: Write scenes that contrast runner loops with elite spectacle.
Use the Wheel as omnipresent symbol: turning, groaning, threatening to break.
Make Undercode feel like a whispering backdoor—temptation and dread.
for_game_design: Core loop: run/commute/work → discover anomalies → access Undercode → attract attention → choose factions → plan heists/operations.
Faction reputations: Respeculators vs Aetherion vs System vs Underground civilians.
